channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024110005
item.description:
Report E-2024110005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a UN2735 Evercat ZR-70 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25 cup of product released to a 1’ x 6” area of the concrete dock floor and tote body due to a crack on the lid of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote to a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents used to clean the spill into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100717
item.description:
Report E-2024100717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver did not inspect containers prior to loading into trailer. Customer had an IBC with a hole taped up. Tote spilled while in transit, ER team contained spill and conducted clean up.

item.title: Report X-2024101370
item.description:
Report X-2024101370

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: ENID
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: FRA inspector found product on top of the car on the manway nozzle. Contractor inspected the manway and found manway swing bolts loose and damaged manway gasket.
